intro: Disticholiparis compressa, commonly known as the compressed frond fern, is a species of aquatic fern belonging to the family Marsileaceae. It is characterized by its small, floating leaves that are typically compressed and oval in shape. The plant thrives in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, often found in ponds and marshes. Its reproductive structures include tiny, greenish flowers that develop into small, bladder-like fruits. Disticholiparis compressa plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various microorganisms and invertebrates.
